Nashua.G.O. Sanders House: The G.O. Sanders House is a historic house at 10 Derry Street (New Hampshire Route 102) in the center of Hudson, New Hampshire. Built in 1873-75 by George Sanders, this 2-1/2 story wood frame house is a well-preserved example of French Second Empire style. It has a mansard roof with flared eaves, and a three-story tower topped with a mansard roof, above which is a platform with Stick decoration, a wrought iron railing, and a wrought iron canopy topped by a spire.
